doc.name: Sensor
doc.description: This is a wireless sensor node that senses evaders in the sensor field. The sensors in the field communicate with each other to construct a spanning tree from the root node (where the evader is close to) to nodes that are one hop from the root node and so on. When a sensor detects the evader, it sets itself as the root and broadcast a message to its neighbor nodes. The message includes the time when the evader is detected, the location and the depth, zero for the root node, of the sensor. If a sensor receives a message from another sensor, it checks whether the root node has been changed from last time (by check the detected time), or whether there is a shorter path to the root node. If so, it records the detected time, updates the information of its parent node (location and depth in the tree) and broadcast a message, include the detected time, its location and depth in the tree, to it neighbot nodes. By doing this in a sensor network, a spaning tree is constructed distributedly and sensors are indexed according to how far it is from the root node. With the evader moving, it may be detected by another sensor, and the tree changes dynamically.
doc.author: Yang Zhao

Port that transmits the update message for the spanning tree. This has type {location={double}, time=double, depth =int}, a record token.
